name: pentathlon

an Olympic sport that includes five events: swimming, fencing (= fighting with long thin swords), showjumping (= riding horses over fences), and cross-country running (= running a long distance in the countryside) combined with shooting: The pentathlon was created by the International Olympic Committee's founder Baron Pierre de Coubertin. He came into pentathlon through swimming, his strongest event. Synonym
modern pentathlon
a sport that includes five athletics (= running, jumping, and throwing) events : Mary Peters won the pentathlon at the 1972 Olympics. She began competing in pentathlon at the age of 12. Compare
biathlon
decathlon
heptathlon
